snippet: Senator Thad Cochran will face his Tea Party-backed challenger, State Senator Chris McDaniel, in a runoff election on June 24.
abstract: Sen Thad Cochran, Republican of Mississippi, will face Tea Party-backed challenger, State Senator Chris McDaniel, in a runoff election on June 24; Cochran campaign efforts to lure Democrats and independents to cast ballots in runoff election are sure to be difficult, in part because state law bars voters who cast ballots in one party's primary from running in another party's runoff.

byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Flowood, and Jonathan Martin from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Senator Thad Cochran will face his Tea Party-backed challenger, State Senator Chris McDaniel, in a runoff election on June 24.

headline.seo: Thad Cochran and Chris McDaniel Tied in Primary
headline.main: Incumbent in Mississippi Runoff Aims for More Than Just G.O.P. Votes
headline.print_headline: Incumbent in Mississippi Runoff Aims for More Than Just G.O.P. Votes
